00035 //       ~~~~~~~~~   mmdb::ContString     ( containered string         )
00036 //                   mmdb::ClassContainer ( container of classes       )

00040 //  **** Functions : Date9to11  ( DD-MMM-YY   -> DD-MMM-YYYY          )
00041 //       ~~~~~~~~~~~ Date11to9  ( DD-MMM-YYYY -> DD-MMM-YY            )
00042 //                   Date9toCIF ( DD-MMM-YY   -> YYYY-MM-DD           )
00043 //                   Date11toCIF( DD-MMM-YYYY -> YYYY-MM-DD           )
00044 //                   DateCIFto9 ( YYYY-MM-DD  -> DD-MMM-YY            )
00045 //                   DateCIFto11( YYYY-MM-DD  -> DD-MMM-YYYY          )
00046 //                   GetInteger ( reads integer from a string         )
00047 //                   GetReal    ( reads real from a string            )
00048 //                   GetIntIns  ( reads integer and insert code       )
00049 //                   PutInteger ( writes integer into a string        )
00050 //                   PutRealF   ( writes real in F-form into a string )
00051 //                   PutIntIns  ( writes integer and insert code      )
00052 //                   CIFGetInteger ( reads and deletes int from CIF   )
00053 //                   CIFGetReal    ( reads and deletes real from CIF  )
00054 //                   CIFGetString  ( reads and deletes string from CIF)
00055 //                   CIFGetInteger1 (reads and del-s int from CIF loop)
00056 //                   CIFGetReal1    (reads and del-s int from CIF loop)
00057 //                   Mat4Inverse    ( inversion of 4x4 matrices       )
00058 //                   GetErrorDescription (ascii line to an Error_XXXXX)
00059 //                   ParseAtomID    ( parses atom ID line             )
00060 //                   ParseResID     ( parses residue ID line          )
00061 //                   ParseAtomPath  ( parses full atom path           )

00098   // =================  Format functions  ==================
00099 
00100   //   Returns true if S contains an integer number in its
00101   // first M characters. This number is returned in N.
00102   //   The return is false if no integer number may be
00103   // recognized. In this case, N is assigned MinInt4 value.
00104   extern bool GetInteger ( int & N, cpstr S, int M );
00105 
00106   //   Returns true if S contains a real number in its
00107   // first M characters. This number is returned in R.
00108   //   The return is false if no real number may be
00109   // recognized. In this case, R is assigned -MaxReal value.
00110   extern bool GetReal ( realtype & R, cpstr S, int M );
00111 
00112   //   Returns true if S contains an integer number in its
00113   // first M characters. This number is returned in N. In addition
00114   // to that, GetIntIns() retrieves the insertion code which may
00115   // follow the integer and returns it in "ins" (1 character +
00116   // terminating 0).
00117   //   The return is false if no integer number may be
00118   // recognized. In this case, N is assigned MinInt4 value,
00119   // "ins" just returns (M+1)th symbol of S (+terminating 0).
00120   extern bool  GetIntIns ( int & N, pstr ins, cpstr S, int M );
00121 
00122   //  Integer N is converted into ASCII string of length M
00123   // and pasted onto first M characters of string S. No
00124   // terminating zero is added.
00125   //  If N is set to MinInt4, then first M characters of
00126   // string S are set to space.
00127   extern void  PutInteger ( pstr S, int N, int M );
00128 
00129   //  Real R is converted into ASCII string of length M
00130   // and pasted onto first M characters of string S. No
00131   // terminating zero is added. The conversion is done
00132   // according to fixed format FM.L
00133   //  If R is set to -MaxReal, then first M characters of
00134   // string S are set to the space character.
00135   extern void  PutRealF ( pstr S, realtype R, int M, int L );
00136 
00137   //  Integer N is converted into ASCII string of length M
00138   // and pasted onto first M characters of string S. No
00139   // terminating zero is added. The insert code ins is put
00140   // immediately after the integer.
00141   //  If N is set to MinInt4, then first M+1 characters of
00142   // string S are set to space, and no insert code are
00143   // appended.
00144   extern void  PutIntIns ( pstr S, int N, int M, cpstr ins );
00145

00159                                       cpstr DefS,
00160                                       bool Remove=true );
00161

00223   DefineClass(ContainerClass);

00226   class ContainerClass : public io::Stream  {
00227 
00228     friend class ClassContainer;
00229 
00230     public :
00231 
00232       ContainerClass ();
00233       ContainerClass ( io::RPStream Object );
00234       ~ContainerClass() {}
00235 
00236       //    ConvertPDBASCII(..) will return one of the Error_XXXXX
00237       // constants, see <mmdb_defs.h>
00238       virtual ERROR_CODE ConvertPDBASCII ( cpstr )
00239                                          { return Error_NoError; }
00240       virtual void PDBASCIIDump    ( pstr, int ) {}
00241       virtual bool PDBASCIIDump1   ( io::RFile ) { return false; }
00242       virtual void MakeCIF         ( mmcif::PData, int ) {}
00243 
00244       //   Append(..) should return true if CC is appended to this class.
00245       // If this is not the case, CC is merely put on the top of
00246       // container.
00247       //   Note: Append(..) detects the necessity to append CC and
00248       // performs all the necessary actions for that. The rest of CC
00249       // will be disposed by Class Container.
00250       //   Note: Class Container checks every new class, which is
00251       // being added to it (see CClassContainer::AddData(..)), only
00252       // against the top of container.
00253       virtual bool Append ( PContainerClass CC );
00254 
00255       //  GetCIF(..) extracts any necessary information from CIF and
00256       //  returns in Signal:
00257       //    Error_noError : the information was successfully extracted,
00258       //                  this instance of container class should be
00259       //                  stored, and unchanged value of Signal should
00260       //                  be passed to the next (newly created) instance
00261       //                  of this container class.
00262       //    Error_EmptyCIF : there is no information for this type of
00263       //                  containers to extract. This instance of
00264       //                  container class should be deleted and input
00265       //                  for this type of container class terminated.
00266       //    Other          : the corresponding error. This instance of
00267       //                  container class should be deleted and the
00268       //                  whole input stopped.
00269       virtual ERROR_CODE GetCIF ( mmcif::PData, int & n )
00270                                      { n = -1; return Error_EmptyCIF; }
00271       virtual CLASS_ID GetClassID () { return ClassID_Template; }
00272 
00273       virtual void Copy ( PContainerClass ) {}
00274 
00275       void write ( io::RFile ) {}
00276       void read  ( io::RFile ) {}
00277 
00278     protected :
00279       int  ContinuationNo;
00280 
00281   };

00364   DefineClass(AtomPath);
00365   DefineStreamFunctions(AtomPath);
00366 
00367   enum APATH_FLAG  {
00368     APATH_ModelNo     = 0x00000001,
00369     APATH_ChainID     = 0x00000002,
00370     APATH_SeqNum      = 0x00000004,
00371     APATH_InsCode     = 0x00000008,
00372     APATH_ResName     = 0x00000010,
00373     APATH_AtomName    = 0x00000020,
00374     APATH_Element     = 0x00000040,
00375     APATH_AltLoc      = 0x00000080,
00376     APATH_Incomplete  = 0x00000100,
00377     APATH_WC_ModelNo  = 0x00001000,
00378     APATH_WC_ChainID  = 0x00002000,
00379     APATH_WC_SeqNum   = 0x00004000,
00380     APATH_WC_InsCode  = 0x00008000,
00381     APATH_WC_ResName  = 0x00010000,
00382     APATH_WC_AtomName = 0x00020000,
00383     APATH_WC_Element  = 0x00040000,
00384     APATH_WC_AltLoc   = 0x00080000
00385   };
00386 
00387   class AtomPath : public io::Stream  {
00388 
00389     public :
00390 
00391       int      modelNo;
00392       ChainID  chainID;
00393       int      seqNum;
00394       InsCode  insCode;
00395       ResName  resName;
00396       AtomName atomName;
00397       Element  element;
00398       AltLoc   altLoc;
00399       int      isSet;
00400 
00401       AtomPath  ();
00402       AtomPath  ( cpstr ID );
00403       AtomPath  ( io::RPStream Object );
00404       ~AtomPath ();
00405 
00406       //  SetPath(..) parses the Atom Path ID string, which
00407       //  may be incomplete. Below {..} means blocks that
00408       //  may be omitted; any elements within such blocks
00409       //  may be omitted as well.
00410       //
00411       //  1. If ID starts with '/' then the ID must be of
00412       //     the following form:
00413       //   /mdl{/chn{/seq(res).i{/atm[elm]:a}}}
00414       //
00415       //  2. If ID starts with a letter:
00416       //        chn{/seq(res).i{/atm[elm]:a}}
00417       //
00418       //  3. If ID starts with a number or '(':
00419       //            seq(res).i{/atm[elm]:a}
00420       //
00421       //  4. If ID contains colon ':' or '[' then
00422       //     it may be just
00423       //                       atm[elm]:a
00424       //
00425       //  The following are valid samples of IDs:
00426       //
00427       //     /1      model number 1
00428       //     /1/A/23(GLU).A/CA[C]:A  model number 1, chain A,
00429       //             residue 23 GLU insertion code A, C-alpha
00430       //             atom in alternative location A
00431       //     A/23    residue 23 of chain A
00432       //     CA[C]:  atom C-alpha
00433       //     [C]     a carbon
00434       //     *[C]:*  same as above
00435       //     :A      an atom with insertion code A
00436       //     5       residue number 5
00437       //     (GLU)   residue GLU
00438       //
00439       //   All spaces are ignored. SetPath(..) sets bit of isSet
00440       // for each element present. Any element may be a wildcard
00441       // '*'. Wildcard for model will set modelNo=0, for sequence
00442       // number will set seqNum=MinInt4.
00443       //
00444       // Returns:
00445       //   0   <-> Ok
00446       //   -1  <-> wrong numerical format for model
00447       //   -2  <-> wrong numerical format for sequence number
00448       int SetPath ( cpstr ID );
00449 
00450       void write ( io::RFile f );
00451       void read  ( io::RFile f );
00452 
00453     protected :
00454       void InitAtomPath();
00455 
00456   };
00457 
00458

00471       void Sort ( void * sortdata, int data_len );
00472 
00473     protected :
00474       int    selSortLimit,dlen;
00475       void * data;
00476 
00477       void SelectionSort ( int left, int right );
00478       int  Partition     ( int left, int right );
00479       void Quicksort     ( int left, int right );
00480 
00481   };

00484   //  --------------------------------------------------------------
00485 
00486   extern void  takeWord ( pstr & p, pstr wrd, cpstr ter, int l );
00487 
00488   //   ParseAtomID(..) reads the atom ID of the following form:
00489   //    {name} {[element]} {:altcode}
00490   // (here {} means that the item may be omitted; any field may have
00491   // value of wildcard '*'), and returns the atom name in aname,
00492   // element name - in elname, and alternate location code - in aloc.
00493   // Except for the alternate location code, missing items are
00494   // replaced by wildcards. Missing alternate location code is
00495   // returned as empty string "".
00496   //   Leading spaces are allowed; any other space will terminate
00497   // the parsing.
00498   //   The followings are perfectly valid atom IDs:
00499   //        CA[C]:A     (carbon C_alpha in location A)
00500   //        CA[*]:A     (either C_alpha or Ca in location A)
00501   //        CA:A        (same as above)
00502   //        CA          (either C_alpha or Ca with no location indicator)
00503   //        CA[]        (same as above)
00504   //        CA[C]:      (C_alpha with no location indicator)
00505   //        [C]         (any carbon with no location indicator)
00506   //        [C]:*       (any carbon with any location indicator)
00507   //        *[C]:*      (same as above)
00508   //        :A          (any atom in location A)
00509   //        *[*]:A      (same as above)
00510   //        *[*]:*      (any atom)
00511   //        *           (any atom with no alternate location indicator)
00512   extern void ParseAtomID ( cpstr ID, AtomName aname,
00513                             Element elname, AltLoc   aloc );
00514 
00515   //   ParseResID(..) reads the residue ID of the following form:
00516   //    {seqnum} {(name)} {.inscode}
00517   // (here {} means that the item may be omitted; any field may have
00518   // value of wildcard '*'), and returns the sequence number in sn,
00519   // insertion code - in inscode, and residue name - in resname.
00520   // If a wildcard was specified for the sequence number, then
00521   // ParseResID(..) returns 1. Missing residue name is replaced by
00522   // the wildcard '*', and misisng insertion code is returned as empty
00523   // string "".
00524   //   Leading spaces are allowed; any other space will terminate
00525   // the parsing.
00526   //   Return 0 means Ok, 1 - wildcard for the sequence number,
00527   // 2 - an error in numerical format of the sequence number
00528   // (other items are parsed).
00529   //   The followings are perfectly valid residue IDs:
00530   //        27(ALA).A   (residue 27A ALA)
00531   //        27().A      (residue 27A)
00532   //        27(*).A     (same as above)
00533   //        27.A        (same as above)
00534   //        27          (residue 27)
00535   //        27().       (same as above)
00536   //        (ALA)       (any ALA without insertion code)
00537   //        (ALA).      (same as above)
00538   //        (ALA).*     (any ALA)
00539   //        *(ALA).*    (any ALA)
00540   //        .A          (any residue with insertion code A)
00541   //        *(*).A      (same as above)
00542   //        *(*).*      (any residue)
00543   //        *           (any residue with no insertion code)
00544   extern int ParseResID ( cpstr ID, int & sn,
00545                           InsCode inscode, ResName resname );
00546 
00547 
00548   //   ParseAtomPath(..) parses an atom path string of the following
00549   // structure:
00550   //   /mdl/chn/seq(res).i/atm[elm]:a
00551   // where all items may be represented by a wildcard '*' and
00552   //   mdl   - model number (mandatory); at least model #1 is always
00553   //           present; returned in mdl; on a wildcard mdl is set to 0
00554   //   chn   - chain identifier ( mandatory); returned in chn; on a
00555   //           wildcard chn is set to '*'
00556   //   seq   - residue sequence number (mandatory); returned in sn;
00557   //           on a wild card ParseAtomPath(..) returns 1
00558   //   (res) - residue name in round brackets (may be omitted);
00559   //           returnded in res; on a wildcard res is set to '*'
00560   //   .i    - insert code after a dot; if '.i' or 'i' is missing
00561   //           then a residue without an insertion code is looked for;
00562   //           returned in ic; on a wildcard (any insertion code would
00563   //           do) ic is set to '*'
00564   //   atm   - atom name (mandatory); returned in atm; on a wildcard
00565   //           atm is set to '*'
00566   //   [elm] - chemical element code in square brackets; it may
00567   //           be omitted but could be helpful for e.g.
00568   //           distinguishing C_alpha and CA; returned in elm;
00569   //           in a wildcard elm is set to '*'
00570   //   :a    - alternate location indicator after colon; if
00571   //           ':a' or 'a' is missing then an atom without
00572   //           alternate location indicator is looked for; returned
00573   //           in aloc; on a wildcard (any alternate code would do)
00574   //           aloc is set to '*'.
00575   // All spaces are ignored, all identifiers should be in capital
00576   // letters (comparisons are case-sensitive).
00577   //   The atom path string may be incomplete. If DefPath is supplied,
00578   // the function will try to get missing elements from there. If
00579   // missing items may not be found in DefPath, they are replaced by
00580   // wildcards.
00581   //   ParseAtomPath(..) returns the following bits:
00582   //      0                 - Ok
00583   //      APATH_Incomplete  - if path contains wildcards. Wildcards for
00584   //                          residue name and chemical element will be
00585   //                          ignored here if sequence number and
00586   //                          atom name, correspondingly, are provided.
00587   //      APATH_WC_XXXXX    - wildcard for different elements
00588   //      -1                - wrong numerical format for model (fatal)
00589   //      -2                - wrong numerical format for seqNum (fatal)
00590 
00591   extern int ParseAtomPath ( cpstr     ID,
00592                              int &     mdl,
00593                              ChainID   chn,
00594                              int &     sn,
00595                              InsCode   ic,
00596                              ResName   res,
00597                              AtomName  atm,
00598                              Element   elm,
00599                              AltLoc    aloc,
00600                              PAtomPath DefPath=NULL );
00601
